div.head: CAP. I
Concerning those who receive the sacrament and the thing, those who receive the thing and not the sacrament, and those who receive the Sacrament and not the thing.
div.p: Here it should be said that, some receive the sacrament and the thing, some the Sacrament and not the thing, some the thing and not the sacrament.

All children receive the sacrament and the thing, who in baptism are cleaned from original sin; although some deny that sin is removed from those children who are about to die at the moment of baptism, relying on that word of
Augustine :
Sacraments only accomplish what they symbolize in the elect; not merely in those understanding, that it should be thus accepted, because when it effects the remission in others, it does not do this to them for salvation, but only for the elect.
Enchiridion, c. 43, n. 13 .

But that for all children there is the removal of sin in baptism, it is evidently said by
Augustine :
from a child, he says, recently born up to a decrepit old person, just as no one is prohibited from baptism, so no one is, who is not dead in sin,
but children only have original sin, indeed it is greater to all those things, which by living badly have added to that
Enchiridion, c. 43, n. 13 , unless they are impeded by the enormity of life. Adults also, which are baptized with faith receive the sacrament and the thing.
